div.h2: PCB DFM and Supplier Quality Engineer

li.title: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.

ul.li: have at least 10 years experience the printed circuit including hands-on process engineering experience
have a strong knowledge of industry specifications, especially IPC and JEDEC specifications
understand the relationship between manufacturing processes and printed circuit defect conditions, especially latent defects
understand statistical process and quality control principles and be capable to apply statistical analysis methods to raw data sets

div.p:
This responsibilities of this role include:
- maintenance of printed circuit board design guidelines for all Apple products - maintenance of printed circuit board technology roadmap - maintenance of printed circuit board acceptability specifications - establishment and maintenance of supplier site/material/technology qualification matrix - action as the directly responsible individual all printed circuit board related quality issues and excursions
In the course of fulfilling these responsibilities the person in this role will:
- provide guidance to product designers on available printed circuit board technologies and materials - interact with and guide PCB layout designers to select layer structures, design rule sets and practices - work with design tool engineers to define and validate appropriate scripting, design rule checks, etc - support design for cost investigations as the bridge between engineering and procurement - audit and assess PCB vendor production lines, including manufacturing techniques and quality control systems - review new technology qualification data and make disposition decisions - review new product introduction first article data and make disposition decisions - drive corrective actions for PCB vendor issues using step by step methodology
A BS or higher in materials science or chemical, mechanical or electrical engineering is strongly desired

- have a current knowledge of industry design rules capabilities and practices for different types of products - be familiar with PCB design and simulation tools - be willing and able to travel overseas up to 25% of the time, including trips on very short notice as well as for extended stays
